messages.author: jeremya
messages.text: For some reason, the WS_CAPTION style gets added to the window even when I tried not specifying it in CreateWindowEx.

messages.author: Ben Goodger (Google)
messages.text: Finally... why do you need to do this?

messages.author: Ben Goodger (Google)
messages.text: Look at ScopedRedrawLock in this file. It does the visibility munging for you.

messages.author: jeremya
messages.text:
On 2012/02/16 02:53:49, Ben Goodger (Google) wrote:
> Finally... why do you need to do this?

Without this, when the window loses focus, Windows paints a bunch of white over its border.

messages.author: jeremya
messages.text:
On 2012/02/16 02:53:49, Ben Goodger (Google) wrote:
> Look at ScopedRedrawLock in this file. It does the visibility munging for you.

ScopedRedrawLock doesn't do anything when Aero is enabled. (see NativeWidgetWin::LockUpdates())

messages.author: Ben Goodger (Google)
messages.text: Can you add an alternate ctor or flag to SRL then that allows it to work in this case? I'd rather limit the hackery to one place.

messages.author: jeremya
messages.text:
On 2012/02/16 03:53:01, Ben Goodger (Google) wrote:
